zone.line: You Where seize I you, endless Nature!
You breast where? ye springs of love
On which Heaven & Earth depends,
Ye spring, ye drink, & languish I thus in vain?
(He strikes unwillingly the book round, &
percieves the emblem of the Earth-Spirit)
How otherwise operates this character to me alone
Thou, Spirit of the Earth, art to me near
Already feel I my power higher
Already rejoice I as with new wine
I feel courage, myself in the world to ?hazad
T Of the Earth Woe, of the Earth bliss to endure,
With tempests me around to beat
And in the vessels' crash nothing to be dismayed
It clouds thus over me
The lamp moon withdraws its light
The lamp wavers!
It goes out — it moves red beam
To me around the head — it breathes.
An horror from the Arch above
